main event: A male civilian reported observing a formation of about 12 disc-shaped objects in the eastern sky over Weimar, California on August 18, 1949.
interesting points: The objects were moving North-South to the West at a speed of about 700 M.P.H. at an altitude of approximately 5,000 feet., The objects exhibited unusual behavior by bobbing up and down for 30 to 40 seconds., The diameter of the observed objects was between 50 to 100 feet., The terrain around Weimar is mountainous, located 50 miles north of Donner Summit., The observer reported no audible sound from the objects during the sighting.
sighted object: a formation of about 12 disc-shaped objects
